text: There were so much affairs of me created by the media... of course I was not always a true single. I had some relations, once also to a famous pop star.
author: Gabriela Sabatini

text: It wasn't being an alcoholic - it was going wild. It happened when I got famous. It was like having my teens in my early thirties: blotting out your life, not having to think about anything.

text: I follow the most random people on Twitter. I follow famous people like Khloe Kardashian, who surprisingly makes really funny tweets all the time.
author: Chloe Moretz

text: I really hate the duties of being a celebrity, like getting dressed up for the red carpet.
author: America Ferrera

text: If you want to be a rock star or just be famous, then run down the street naked, you'll make the news or something. But if you want music to be your livelihood, then play, play, play and play! And eventually you'll get to where you want to be.

text: Slowly but surely, we are acquiring that famous culture of democracy, which is our objective.
author: Paul Biya

text: You know, one of the biggest thrills I have is when famous people recognize me from Taxi.
author: Marilu Henner

text: My ultimate dream is to become a famous star because I love to sing.
author: Lucy Hale

text: My hair was famous before I was.
author: Christopher Walken

text: I don't care how famous a guitarist is, he ain't learned everything. There's always somewhere to go, something to mash up, but he ain't found it yet. You never learn everything on that guitar neck.
author: David Edwards

text: You've got certain guys that just want to be famous and then you've got the real musicians that just love playing music.
author: Zakk Wylde

text: I made my living being 20 or 30 pounds heavier than the average model. And that's where I got famous.
author: Tyra Banks

text: The whole business of getting famous was good fun, but it was a long time ago.
author: Julian Clary

text: I still forgive him, because by doing what he did, he made it famous.
author: Alberto Korda

text: Quentin is very organic there was no way that he was going to put someone else's hand in there and anyway, my hands are kind of famous. It seemed right.
author: David Carradine

text: I don't like being famous - it is like a prison. And driving for Ferrari would make it far worse.
author: Valentino Rossi

text: Celebrity distorts democracy by giving the rich, beautiful, and famous more authority than they deserve.
author: Maureen Dowd

text: These days there are a lot of people who just want to be famous. I think that comes from a naive place, because those people generally don't know what it's like.
author: Catherine Keener

text: When I was going for my graduate degree, I decided I was going to make a feature film as my thesis. That's what I was famous for-that I had my thesis film be a feature film, which was 'You're a Big Boy Now.'
author: Francis Ford Coppola

text: I can deal with it now, but 13 is a tough age to be recognized and famous. It's a tough age, period.
author: Bill Skarsgard

text: It was a mixed blessing to have famous parents. It was tough to go to auditions and be bad, since I couldn't be anonymous.
author: Ben Stiller

text: It struck me that working digitally with a small crew, I could lay out a general plan for Famous and hope for mistakes which would create something more than satire and something less than truthful reality.
author: Griffin Dunne

text: But I know newspapers. They have the first amendment and they can tell any lie knowing it's a lie and they're protected if the person's famous or it's a company.
author: Steve Wozniak

text: I think anybody who's famous has to deal with their fame in their own way, and I dealt with it by making a film about a kid who's looking out into the world of celebrity obsession.
author: Adrian Grenier

text: It's quite a famous story that takes place on Christmas Eve, and the Germans, French, and Scottish are trying to make peace one night and they bury their dead and they play football. I play a German opera singer, in German, which I never have so I am really excited about that.
author: Diane Kruger

text: The hardest thing about being famous is that people are always nice to you. You're in a conversation and everybody's agreeing with what you're saying - even if you say something totally crazy. You need people who can tell you what you don't want to hear.
author: Al Pacino

text: Nothing in life prepares you to be famous.
author: Jeff Foxworthy

text: For somebody famous, it's weird anyway to meet someone, because they have a preconceived notion of who you are.
author: Ricki Lake

text: Famous pivot stories are often failures but you don't need to fail before you pivot. All a pivot is is a change is strategy without a change in vision. Whenever entrepreneurs see a new way to achieve their vision - a way to be more successful - they have to remain nimble enough to take it.
author: Eric Ries

text: The world's most famous and popular language is music.
author: PSY

text: Becoming famous and selling a lot of records doesn't change a thing.
author: Macy Gray

text: Sometimes you're famous before you're good.
author: Maggie Q

text: I think it's really important for celebrities to use their power of money and fame to get their voices out there. It's funny to me that we're expected to keep quiet just because of who we are. Why do I lose my right to speak my mind because I'm famous?

text: Well, I knew I wanted to be an actor, and I didn't necessarily need or want to be famous or a celebrity actor.
author: Jenna Fischer

text: I wanted to be a political science professor and go to school in Boston. I never wanted to be a big, famous movie star and TV star. It kind of found me.
author: Eliza Dushku

text: I didn't set out to be famous if I'd wanted that, I would have gone on 'Big Brother.'
author: Sam Worthington

text: Being famous is not something that would make me feel successful - unless one was striving for mediocrity.
author: William Hurt

text: I was brought up with psychics and tarot cards. My mum was always told I was going to be in a boy band and be famous as a singer.
author: Lee Ryan

text: And my marriage was perfect when I wasn't famous.
author: Damon Wayans

text: That save from Pele's header was the best I ever made. I didn't have any idea how famous it would become - to start with, I didn't even realise I'd made it at all.
author: Gordon Banks

text: There were a few years there when I was just so enamored with the idea of living some sort of famous person's lifestyle that really isn't suited to me.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

text: Some of the most famous books are the least worth reading. Their fame was due to their having done something that needed to be doing in their day. The work is done and the virtue of the book has expired.
author: Moliere

text: I'm not cut out to be a famous person I can't do my hair and makeup well enough.
author: Jennifer Weiner

text: At each of these northern posts there were interesting experiences in store for me, as one who had read all the books of northern travel and dreamed for half a lifetime of the north and that was - almost daily meeting with famous men.
author: Ernest Thompson Seton

text: You aren't famous until my mother has heard of you.
author: Jay Leno

text: A library, to modify the famous metaphor of Socrates, should be the delivery room for the birth of ideas - a place where history comes to life.
author: Norman Cousins

text: Being famous is great, it's not like bad or horrible or anything.
author: Dave Chappelle

text: I've been around some very famous people, but no one has the effect Maradona has people tremble in his presence.
author: Emir Kusturica

text: There's this common perception that having a famous last name is all you need. A surname may get you a meeting, but if there's no talent you won't get the part.
author: Lily Collins

text: I always loved working as an actress, but I didn't understand why I couldn't just opt out of being famous. And then I realized you can, and I think I did. And eventually, I came to understand that you can do that and also keep working.
author: Debra Winger

text: There's always going to be that pressure when you're in front of the camera. When you're famous it's just an extreme version of reality and there's a pressure to look a certain way.
author: Geri Halliwell

text: Lance Armstrong, the famous cyclist and more importantly, cancer survivor, has said 'if you ever get a second chance for something, you've got to go all the way.'
author: Michael N. Castle

text: I had no desire to be famous I just wanted to make the greatest music ever made. I didn't want anyone to know who I was.
author: Robert Smith

text: People are much more inclined to believe and say bad things about you if you're famous.
author: Danielle Steel

text: In fact, I'd just like to own something. Everyone thinks I'm glamorous, rich and famous but all I've got is some recording equipment and a battered old BMW.

text: When I started out, I didn't have any desire to be an actress or to learn how to act. I just wanted to be famous.
author: Katharine Hepburn

text: The seven wise men of Greece, so famous for their wisdom all the world over, acquired all that fame, each of them, by a single sentence consisting of two or three words.

text: I wrote because I needed to and wanted to. It never occurred to me that I'd become famous.
author: Danielle Steel

text: Being big and famous doesn't get you more freedom, it gets you less.
author: Robert Wyatt

text: Popstars really draws you in. It's fascinating. It's interesting to watch people thrown together in that kind of a situation. Even if the egos weren't involved and they weren't trying to be world famous. It's the Real World, only better.

text: These days, with 'American Idol' and all the other reality shows, young people become famous overnight, and that can be very difficult to handle, the way photographers follow you around and study your every move.

text: It took me fifteen years to discover I had no talent for writing, but I couldn't give it up because by that time I was too famous.

text: People don't get through to the essence of you right away - it's always the famous 'girl' or the famous 'girlfriend'. I'd rather be known for myself.

text: It's more important for me to feel content than to be famous.
author: Samantha Morton

text: Quite frankly, I didn't become an actor to become a movie star. I have never dreamed about being the most famous person on the planet. I just want to do really good work.
author: Anne Hathaway

text: Having bodyguards is just part of being famous, I think.
author: Dolph Lundgren

text: They were all famous and fantastic fellows.
author: Peter Scott

text: At first, I thoroughly enjoyed being famous.
author: Phil Donahue

text: Fame is something I think happens as a result of trying to do good work. If you're trying to be famous, your work usually suffers.
author: Justin Theroux

text: Anytime you cast a movie and you need someone famous in the lead part, you're a prisoner of whoever happens to be famous in the six-month window in which you're trying to get a film financed.
author: Alexander Payne

text: I'm a bit jealous. Until two days ago someone told me I am the most famous Korean in the world.
author: PSY

text: Being famous hasn't changed my perception of myself - I've just grown up.
author: Cat Deeley

text: I became famous, I think, really because of the interpretation of other people's songs, way back when, and that's what I enjoy the most. And I'm a lazy bugger.
author: Rod Stewart

text: How many famous and high-spirited heroes have lived a day too long?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: I never wanted to do biography just to tell the life of a famous man. I always wanted to use the life of a man to examine political power, because democracy shapes our lives.
author: Robert Caro

text: I don't know how to construct a career that'll make me famous. Except maybe get my ears pinned back, get my teeth done, and go to America. But then I'll be competing with billions of actors who haven't got false teeth, and who are 25.

text: Being very famous is not the fun it sounds. It merely means you're being chased by a lot of people and you lose your privacy.

text: When famous people come up to you it's a bit weird, but it's an honour, really, when they recognise you and want to chat to you for a bit.
author: Wayne Rooney

text: We're teaching young girls that this is what they should be focusing on: rich and famous girls who are rich and famous for nothing.

text: If there's anything more mortifying than being famous at 14, it's being washed up right after.

text: I think the driving thing was curiosity about the universe. That fascinated me. I didn't think anything about being famous or anything like that, I was just interested in the concepts involved.

text: I don't put weight on fame, and having people around me just because I am famous makes me feel really bad about myself.

text: Being famous before you've formed your personality, before you have that self-esteem, is dangerous.

text: Duke Ellington was famous for hs very original harmonic patterns.
author: Lawrence Welk

text: The good thing about L.A. is that there's always someone more famous 100 yards away from me.

text: I've wanted to perform my entire life. I found a paper I wrote in kindergarten class about what I wanted to be when I grew up - and I wrote 'a famous singer!'

text: My goal and my career is definitely not to be famous. That's a really horrible goal, just to be famous for the sake of having fame.

text: It's always a little mind-boggling to realize that these famous actors know who I am.

text: Those who have known the famous are publicly debriefed of their memories, knowing as their own dusk falls that they will only be remembered for remembering someone else.

text: I did grow up next door to Steve McQueen, who was a very famous movie star at the time, but as a kid it didn't impress me. We always had great fun with him. He would take us out on Sundays on his motorcycles, riding around in the desert he was like a second father.

text: I'm as famous as I want to be.
author: Tracey Ullman

text: It was I who made Fellini famous, not the other way around.
author: Anita Ekberg

text: There is a misleading, unwritten rule that states if a quote giving advice comes from someone famous, very old, or Greek, then it must be good advice.

text: In a lot of aspects it's cooler that we don't have a lot of really overly famous people in the band.
author: Neal Schon

text: My wife Elizabeth and I started The Really Terrible Orchestra for people like us who are pretty hopeless musicians who would like to play in an orchestra. It has been a great success. We give performances we've become the most famous bad orchestra in the world.
author: Alexander McCall Smith

text: When you see a fantastic colour or cut in a magazine, perched up on some famous so-and-so's head, it's tempting to ask your stylist for the same, but do not be fooled. The hair in those fancy photos can be very high maintenance.

text: It was deeply important for me to understand where Mandela came from. Because we know where he was going, and that's a famous story, but who was he? Where did he come from? What was his upbringing?

text: No one can train you to be famous. How do you deal with the loss of anonymity, the loss of privacy? You have to be disciplined.

text: I never pursued being 'famous.'

text: I worked at a hot dog place, a bagel place, the Jersey Store and the hottest fashion joint around. I was getting too famous to work there anymore. I was almost showing up as a joke. I made $2,000 on my show the previous night and I'm going to go shopping during my five-hour shift.

text: Celebrity, to me, is not a thing to seek.
author: Aidan Quinn

text: Jason Lee is the most famous actor from Hawaii I can think of.
author: Tia Carrere

text: I don't see myself as famous at all so I'm continuing my life as normal.
author: Ashley Madekwe

text: Many medal winners dream of competing in a sport other than the one they're famous for.
author: Mary Lou Retton

text: I'm famous for being nicer to my fans than anyone on the face of the earth because I figure, a) They pay my salary, and b) It's probably like a big moment in your life to meet somebody so I would say, 'Just come on up.'

text: All my life, it's been the same with men. Being a woman who is famous and adored by men is very hard for any boyfriend to handle. All my boyfriends end up insecure.

text: Well I would say that we're regular people first of all and we're normal and it's obvious by some of the things that have happened just because our name is famous we're not immune to tragedy.

text: I never wanted to be rich or successful or famous. I just wanted to be happy and have fun.

text: To be famous, in fact, one has only to kill one's landlady.

text: A chair is a very difficult object. A skyscraper is almost easier. That is why Chippendale is famous.

text: I don't feel famous.
author: Uma Thurman

text: I haven't paid for anything since I became famous.
author: Melissa de la Cruz

text: The strangest part about being famous is you don't get to give first impressions anymore. Everyone already has an impression of you before you meet them.

text: I'm not famous for my back story investigations I'm lucky that I work with good writers and it's usually in the script.

text: I'd love to live in Ireland but I'd like to live as me, not what someone thinks I am. People don't understand - I lived there before I was famous.

text: I keep saying I'm not at all famous in my own country, because people do not think I have done anything for India.

text: If it's not some daring, dangerous affair, it's just not interesting, or so it seems. So, here you have two people - a famous American iconic couple - who actually like each other sexually, in marriage. Imagine.

text: It wasn't not being famous any more, or even not being a recording artist. It was having nobody who needed me, no phones ringing, nothing to do. Because I'm still too young to do nothing. I was only 24 when all that happened. Now, at 40, I feel I've got more to give than I ever have.

text: To put it simply - you know, a lot of people believe that the benefit of this job is fame and fortune. I believe that you pay for the fortune through the fame. I don't buy into the notion that being famous is somehow a good thing, or an exciting thing, or a wonderful thing.

text: Being famous is wicked. But it's better to be normal.
author: Rupert Grint

text: I'm really in no danger of being perceived as a famous movie actor!
author: Lyle Lovett

text: Dates with actors, finally, just seemed to me evenings of shop talk. I got sick of it after a hile. So the more famous I became, the more I narrowed down my choices.

text: I don't want to be famous famous. I'm happy on the second tier, where I have autonomy on a professional level but I can still go out to the movies without being recognized.
author: Gabrielle Reece

text: I was never very interested in boys - and there were plenty of them - vying with one another to see how many famous women they would get into the hay.

text: The idea of being famous is a lot better than the reality.

text: You can be a famous poisoner or a successful poisoner, but not both, and the same seems to apply to Great Train Robbers.

text: But I didn't ask to have somebody nose around in my private life. I didn't even ask to be famous. All I asked was to be able to earn a living making people laugh.

text: Most of my life I have played a lot of famous people but most of them were dead so you have a poetic license.

text: I'm not in the business of becoming famous. And that's the advice I give to younger aspiring actors. Work onstage and do the little roles. In the end it's not important to be seen. It's important to do. There's a lot of disappointment in this business, but my family keeps me grounded.

text: Of course, Hollywood is still making some excellent pictures which reflect the great artistry that made Hollywood famous throughout the world, but these films are exceptions, judging from box office returns and press reviews.

text: It's not a sport you get famous at. If I wanted to be famous, I would have stuck with hockey.

text: I always regarded people who want fame with a lot of suspicion. Unless you have a product to sell, I don't know why anyone would want to be famous. I can't imagine what need that would fill.

text: I thought that somehow your life would be much different when you're famous... and it's not. You just buy more stuff.

text: Once you start telling people you're famous, they believe you.
author: Melissa de la Cruz

text: On the other hand, when I give it closer thought, I realize I'm not enough of a dictator to conduct an orchestra because it requires a pretty awful person. When you read these biographies of famous conductors, they are all awful people who fail in their private relationships.
author: Eberhard Weber

text: I had to do this very aggressive, big score in a very short time, and knowing that in the beginning, middle, and end would be this very, very famous theme, but I still had to weave a score around it and make it work as a score was really challenging.
author: Danny Elfman

text: I wanted to go hide. I wasn't looking to be more famous, I'm famous enough.
author: Howard Stern

text: When I got into the music industry, I wasn't focused on being the most famous artist or even getting a major record deal. It was just to make music on my own terms or create my own image, do my own hair, do my own makeup.

text: One thing about being famous is the people around you, you pay all their bills so they very rarely disagree with you because they want you to pick up the check.

text: I love singing - singing is what I'm famous for doing. Now it's turned into things I am famous for doing - like having rows with my mum or about my boyfriend, so it does get irritating.

text: It's not that I don't want to become famous or that I'm obsessed by my work as an actress, but it's all about not limiting myself, such as putting myself in a little jail that I can escape from.

text: I would like to prove that on TV, everyday lives can be as compelling as the life-styles of the rich and famous. Especially lives that we catch at extraordinary moments.

text: It's very hard to get rich and famous at a young age and handle it well.

text: Actually, bizarrely, in America, I get more appreciation from the odd, unusual stuff I've done, almost because I'm not, if you like, famous in America as I am in England.
author: Steve Coogan

text: In Australia, there is a very famous show called 'Home and Away.' I was cast on that at 15. The day I started filming, my life changed.
author: Tammin Sursok

text: Some very famous directors have started in the mail room, which is just getting inside the studio, getting to know people, getting to know the routine.
author: Kenneth Anger

text: I just think Rosa Parks was overrated. Last time I checked, she got famous for breaking the law.
author: Stephen Colbert

text: I would be a huge hypocrite if I didn't tell you that at one time in my life I thought the way that you made music was you got on a major label and you got famous.

text: It's not like I'm the most famous person in the world.
author: Ron Silver

text: I was a shy kid, but somehow I knew I would make it as a performer. I'd always be telling my mum that I was going to be a famous singer. In my school yearbooks I would write, 'Remember me when I'm famous.' I knew I had a gift.

text: Normally, I name my characters after famous comedians.
author: Paula Danziger

text: I don't come from a famous family and don't have this detachment from everyday people and everyday life. I'm just doing my job and the attention that comes with it is part of the territory.
author: Ed Westwick

text: Being famous was extremely disappointing for me. When I became famous it was a complete drag and it is still a complete drag.

text: Whereas you have someone like Houdini, who works really, really hard to get really, really famous, and then has actual intellectual ideas that he puts into the culture that stay there.
author: Penn Jillette

text: I can't imagine wanting to be famous just for the sake of being famous. I think fame should come along with success, talent.

text: You meet people in Hollywood that are famous, and you're not sure what they got famous for.

text: That the work involved, the willingness to take chances, the commitment, the opportunity to get on stage and make people happy, was more important than becoming famous, or even what I was dancing.

text: We had an interesting thing at that first dinner. It was prior to the availability of several new hotels in Los Angeles, and we were more or less committed to the old Ambassador Hotel that has the famous Coconut Grove.
author: Lew Wasserman

text: I grew up being the girl who would always tune in to watch famous people talk about their careers, how they handled scandals and mega fame. I'm trying to pick up tips.
author: Rebecca Black

text: Celebrity gives us delusion of self importance.
author: Al Goldstein

text: I'm in that comfortable niche where I'm not that famous and sometimes people do need to put a barrier between them and their followers. When you're real famous you need to do that but I'm not that famous so I don't need that kind of barrier.

text: I don't have many famous friends, really, except Simon Cowell.
author: Leona Lewis

text: Being rich and famous isn't all happiness and at times the pressures have got to me.
author: Annni-Frid Lyngstad

text: Did you ever stop to think why cops are always famous for being dumb? Simple. Because they don't have to be anything else.

text: I don't feel famous and I didn't want my autobiography to be like a Paris Hilton story.
author: Beth Ditto

text: I want to be in 'Glee,' but I'm told I'm not famous enough to be a cameo yet.
author: Carey Mulligan

text: I could have been a dental hygienist with nothing bad ever appearing in print about me, but that's not how I've chosen to lead my life. I knew that you put yourself under a microscope the more famous you become.

text: I didn't want to be famous. I just wanted to earn enough money to have a nice life and enjoy acting.
author: David McCallum

text: Becoming famous is a strange thing in your own right.
author: Carnie Wilson

text: It's too late for me to get married before I'm famous. You never know people's intentions.
author: Carmelo Anthony

text: Once you become famous, there is nothing left to become but infamous.
author: Don Johnson

text: But things move in circles: one minute it's the models who are famous, then it's the actresses, then it's the designers.
author: Rachel Hunter

text: To be famous and broke is hard.
author: David Spade

text: After 'Skins' I became mildly famous, which was a bit of a disaster.
author: Nicholas Hoult

text: I want to be famous everywhere.
author: Luciano Pavarotti

text: I've never had a desire to be famous. Lots of actors are actually extremely shy. I have shy areas.
author: Jeremy Northam

text: When I was younger, I used to say, One day I'll be famous.
author: Katie Price

text: My mom just didn't put a very high premium on me being like really famous or really wealthy or anything.
author: Martha Plimpton

text: I had a sense of who I was before I got famous.
author: Joe Rogan

text: One thing I think celebrities shy away from is exposing the reality that we're all the same. Somebody's not more important because they have a Bentley or a big house or a famous boyfriend or plastic surgery - we're all the same.

text: I've always been successful. Now I'm famous and successful.
author: Chazz Palminteri

text: Your face is your calling card, but you're not so famous that you can't go out.
author: Vincent Schiavelli

text: The thing about being famous is, it's weird. The only people who get how weird it is are other famous people.
author: Margot Kidder

text: I just want to be rich and famous.
author: Ian Hart

text: One of the pleasant duties of America's most famous announcers during the relatively short swing era of the big bands was to host late-night remotes from some of the most famous ballrooms throughout the country.
author: Nick Clooney

text: When I first became famous, I didn't know if I could go where I wanted to because I didn't know how people were going to act. Some folks would scream and holler, and I didn't know what to do with that.
author: Jill Scott

text: I became very famous, as a teenager, and my name and photo were splashed in all the media. They made me larger than life, so I wanted to live larger than life, and the only way to do that was to be intoxicated.
author: Cat Stevens

text: I'm officially near-famous. If you've got four year old kids and you've got cable, then you've got no choice but to know who I am. But if you're one of my peers - a 26-year old guy who lives in Manhattan - you have no idea who I am. I'm only famous if you're four.
author: Steve Burns

text: I studied Hitchcock a little bit at University and knew the famous story about the Birds - that he'd tortured Tippi for a day using real birds. I had no idea that it was a five-day onslaught and that it was the tip of an iceberg that carried on through to another film.
author: Toby Jones

text: I didn't want kids to think that to be happy, they had to be famous or rich or live in the big city.
author: Dan Savage

text: Barack Obama is the most famous living person in the history of the world.
author: Dee Dee Myers

text: It's hard to have a bad hair day when you're famous.
author: Marion Jones

text: There's a definite responsibility that comes with being famous. You shouldn't be able to just dress up and look pretty.
author: Rashida Jones

text: When you're a famous, successful person at 16 years old, the rules change for you. Everybody is doing things for you to make life easier so you can go out and play. And I think you miss out on lot of growing up and a lot of reality checks.
author: Chris Evert

text: Being famous is just like being in high school. But I'm not interested in being the cheerleader. I'm not interested in being Gwen Stefani. She's the cheerleader, and I'm out in the smoker shed.
author: Courtney Love

text: Few would argue that Richard Dawkins is the world's most famous atheist, especially now that his friend and rival for the title, Christopher Hitchens, has now gone to meet his Maker.
author: Ray Comfort

text: I lost some of my friends because I got so famous, people who just assumed that I would be different now. I felt like everyone hated me. That is the most unhappy time of my life.
author: Haruki Murakami

text: I imagined being a famous writer would be like being like Jane Austen.
author: J. K. Rowling

text: When you become famous, you start getting invites to parties where there are famous athletes and famous rock stars, politicians, people who have tremendous power and affluence. It's not in my DNA, but certainly I have been exposed to it.
author: Billy Baldwin

text: I've never been more famous than I was, suddenly, in 1986.
author: Wendy Cope

text: I was with a famous comedian when a young fan walked up and asked for an autograph. The comedian blew him off. I'll never forget the look on the young boy's face. He was devastated.
author: Louie Anderson

text: I've learned to stay away from publicity addicts, people who want to be famous for no reason.
author: Paz de la Huerta

text: I do not take any pleasure whatsoever in being a famous person.
author: Donna Leon

text: I get very nervous around famous people and I get nervous around beautiful women.
author: Liev Schreiber

text: I can't advise any of the young ones, because I don't know what their background was, but I would suggest that anyone who wants to be famous more than anything - there's a real problem.
author: Shirley MacLaine

text: When you become famous, being famous becomes your profession.
author: James Carville

text: For a time, at least, I was the most famous person in the entire world.
author: Jesse Owens

text: Olympic Gold changed me and my life dramatically. I became a celebrity overnight and people see me as a famous skater, not a real person.
author: Oksana Baiul

text: What is a movie star? It is an illusion. It was everything I ever wanted to be, but it became a kind of shell, non? It was what made me famous and got me women. But it wasn't real.
author: Jean Claude Van Damme

text: I know I'm not a self-indulgent idiot I also know I'm not the second coming of Deepak Chopra. If I had believed either of those, or both, as some people do when they get famous, that's when the mental illness arrives.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: People should recognize who you are and how you can act rather then how famous you are.
author: Mae Whitman

text: I woke up one morning to find I was famous. I bought a white Rolls-Royce and drove down Sunset Boulevard, wearing dark specs and a white suit, waving like the Queen Mum.
author: Peter O'Toole

text: My goal was not to be famous or rich but to be good at what I did. And that required going to New York and studying and working in the theater.
author: Shirley Knight

text: I always want to say to people who want to be rich and famous: 'try being rich first'. See if that doesn't cover most of it. There's not much downside to being rich, other than paying taxes and having your relatives ask you for money. But when you become famous, you end up with a 24-hour job.
author: Bill Murray

text: Why does anybody want to be famous? You know what's important to me? Having lunch! Pasta! Seeing my friends! Is that so crazy?
author: Sherry Stringfield

text: I guess some people want to be performers because they want to be famous.
author: Jenny Slate

text: Nobody makes bouillabaisse from scratch. It's all a bunch of malarkey. Even the restaurants buy a commercial-grade product. I had a very famous chef tell me that.
author: Sandra Lee

text: Our top story tonight: Famous TV dolphin flipper was arrested today on prostitution ring charges. He allegedly was seen transporting two 16 year olds across state line for immoral porpoises.
author: Colin Mochrie

text: Uncle Brett had a definite vision that he was after, I don't think having a famous father affected him much.
author: Kim Weston

text: Of course there have been times I regretted being the kid in 'E.T.' My world went completely crazy. I was that stupid kind of famous, where you can't go anywhere.
author: Henry Thomas

text: Practically everyone in Hollywood has a neighbor who's been famous, wants to be famous, is famous, has been married to someone famous, worked with someone famous, slept with someone famous, been blackmailed by someone famous.
author: Jennifer Grey

text: They eat the dainty food of famous chefs with the same pleasure with which they devour gross peasant dishes, mostly composed of garlic and tomatoes, or fisherman's octopus and shrimps, fried in heavily scented olive oil on a little deserted beach.
author: Luigi Barzini

text: They gave it to us for about five bucks a week, and we just went there to live. Probably the first band that ever did that back then and it became the famous cottage.
author: Jim Capaldi

text: There are people who appear in the magazines and I don't know who they are. I've never seen anything they've done and their careers are over already. They're famous for maybe 10 minutes. Real careers, I think, take a long time to unfold.
author: Matt Damon

text: It's sour grapes, I admit, I want to be more famous so people are examining my work couplet by couplet, you know what I mean? That's the level where I want to go.
author: Frank Black

text: I really don't know anything else because my brothers were famous when I was two years old. So I know nothing else, no other life.
author: Janet Jackson

text: I walk the streets, take the train, it's real simple. Some actors create their own mythology: 'Oh, I'm so famous I can't go places, because I created this mythology that I'm so famous I can't go places.'
author: Samuel L. Jackson

text: I would have changed my last name if being famous were my goal.
author: Zach Galifianakis

text: In its famous paradox, the equation of money and excrement, psychoanalysis becomes the first science to state what common sense and the poets have long known - that the essence of money is in its absolute worthlessness.
author: Norman O. Brown

text: I didn't know what to expect from a famous movie star maybe that he'd be sort of stuck-up, you know. But not Gary Cooper. He horsed around so much... that I had a hard time painting him.
author: Norman Rockwell

text: The whole celebrity culture thing - I'm fascinated by, and repelled by, and yet I end up knowing about it.
author: Anderson Cooper

text: All I say is that I don't go out with famous men.
author: Samantha Mumba

text: Our most famous writers are Faulkner and Eudora Welty and Flannery O'Connor. It would make sense that the poetry would reflect some of those same values, some of the same techniques.
author: Robert Morgan

text: You do not want to get married at 22! Especially if you're famous, because girls are going to be throwing themselves at you.
author: Usain Bolt

text: My name's Jennifer Ellison and one day I'm going to be famous!
author: Jennifer Ellison

text: I wanted to be famous. I wanted people to talk about me.
author: Haile Gebrselassie

text: I mean he's a very famous director... they're not going to put their... and he's very tough, he doesn't like interference at all, so he kept them at bay.
author: Ronald Harwood

text: I think actors are divided into two groups: one that wants to be an actor to become famous and rich, and the other that wants to be an actor because they have to be. I'm more in the second group.
author: Franka Potente

text: Decide very early on: do you want to be an actor or do you want to be famous? Because they're very different routes.
author: James Purefoy

text: My goal was just to work regularly. I didn't ever expect to be rich or famous. I wanted to be a working character actor.
author: Harrison Ford

text: Yeah, I love being famous. It's almost like being white, y'know?
author: Chris Rock

text: I didn't get hugely famous really quick. It was a slow, gradual process, so I was able to sort of grow into myself and figure out who I was and what I wanted without the glaring spotlight on me telling me who I was.
author: Sarah McLachlan

text: Thank God I arrived the day before yesterday, the first of the month, at this port of San Diego, truly a fine one, and not without reason called famous.
author: Junipero Serra

text: Being famous gets me good concert tickets, good tables in restaurants, good seats at sporting events and that's really about it.
author: Fran Drescher

text: A lot of times on tour it's about, 'OK, where am I today? Wow, I'm in Costa Rica. What is their famous dish?' And it's about trying the food, and really experiencing it.
author: Fergie

text: Look at Jessica Simpson. She's famous for being dumb. I guess it started with Marylyn Monroe, and she actually wasn't that dumb, but that's how she was perceived - and that's what got popular.
author: Danica McKellar

text: It isn't necessary to be rich and famous to be happy. It's only necessary to be rich.
author: Alan Alda

text: I'm the guy that made Joe DiMaggio famous.
author: Lefty Gomez

text: A lot of people these days are not music lovers - they just want to be famous which is a very different thing to what I grew up believing in.
author: Shirley Manson

text: Hold on to that. You have an autograph. I'm going to be famous some day.
author: Haywood Nelson

text: Forget about being world famous, it's hard enough just getting the automatic doors at the supermarket to acknowledge our existence.
author: Doug Coupland

text: The first syndicating I tried was when two partners and I created a production company in 1952. We wanted to syndicate famous Bible stories and sell them for $25 a show.
author: Casey Kasum

text: I want to be so famous that drag queens will dress like me in parades when I'm dead.
author: Laura Kightlinger

text: I'm bored with that line. I never use it anymore. My new line is 'In 15 minutes everybody will be famous.'
author: Andy Warhol

text: When you're rich and famous you are the dominant force in a relationship, even if you try hard not to be. I've talked of sacrificing everything for Fleetwood Mac, but I realize now that it is simply the only thing I've ever wanted to do.
author: Stevie Nicks

text: You know, be an actor because you love to act. Don't be an actor because you think you're going to get famous, because that's luck.
author: Whoopi Goldberg

text: I became famous so quickly and so young - it was daunting. I was immature and I used to say some really stupid things in interviews. I never smiled on stage so I looked really serious, but it was because I hated my teeth and was incredibly nervous.
author: Gary Numan

text: It's not a matter of becoming a superstar. Fame and money aren't the purpose of all this. No actor's going to say, 'I don't want to be famous.' But the main purpose for doing what I'm doing is the passion in the work.
author: Christopher Lambert

text: Because you know when you first become famous, you start walking a little different because people are staring at you.
author: Bono

text: And to me, fame is not a positive thing. The idea of being famous is a lot better than the reality. It's fantastic when you go to premieres and people cheer you, but it's not real. And it's totally not my approach to get my name on a club door just because I can.
author: Tom Felton

text: I've always had confidence. Before I was famous, that confidence got me into trouble. After I got famous, it just got me into more trouble.
author: Bruce Willis

text: I am beautiful, famous and gorgeous.
author: Anna Kournikova

text: I'm terrified of being too famous. What I'm really afraid of is that the audiences will go into the theater and not be able to forget that it's me, that fame will stand in the way of my acting. I want to keep being able to change into different shapes and different personalities.
author: Noomi Rapace

text: But to this day I am convinced that the real reason we met was because Alexander is from Nebraska, and he was completely fascinated that I was about to go off and make a movie with Brando - perhaps the most famous Nebraskan of all.
author: Thomas Haden Church

text: Know the names of past and current artists who are most famous for playing their instruments.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

text: I don't want to be famous as a movie star and have the whole world love me, I want to be a creative actress.
author: Juliette Lewis

text: I don't want to be famous per se, but I want to write books for as long as I can. And I plan on writing a lot.
author: Amanda Hocking

text: Luckily, I think, I never really wanted to be famous, I just wanted to make movies.
author: Seth Rogen

text: The same people who can deny others everything are famous for refusing themselves nothing.
author: Leigh Hunt

text: I wasn't a kid who moved out from Iowa with aspirations of becoming a famous star - I was intrigued by the idea of filmmaking and by the idea of what it would be like to play a character in a movie.
author: Jason Lee

text: Similarly, another famous little quantum fluctuation that programs you is the exact configuration of your DNA.
author: Seth Lloyd

text: I don't want to end up being a circus act, doing my most famous tricks when I'm 70.
author: Pharrell Williams

text: I would have been very happy just working from job to job, paying my rent one movie at a time. I never wanted to be this famous. I never imagined this life for myself.
author: Kristen Stewart

text: My philosophy was, if I just do good work, someone will like it enough to employ me. It never made me famous. And I'm way, way too old now, mate. That boat's sailed.
author: Ian Hart

text: I had one fight in my adult life. I had the famous '89 fight with Nicole, which she admits that she initiated the physical part.
author: O. J. Simpson

text: Why am I so famous? What am I doing right? What are the others doing wrong?
author: Barbra Streisand

text: Being in 'Us Weekly' does not make you famous.
author: Bradley Cooper

text: In the beginning, I loved being famous, but now I am tired of it and I would like to go back to my freedom.
author: Roberto Cavalli

text: I'd probably be famous now if I wasn't such a good waitress.
author: Jane Siberry

text: I never wanted to be famous. I only wanted to be great.
author: Ray Charles

text: A famous person to themselves, they don't get up in the morning and think, I'm famous. I'm not famous to me. Famous is a perception.
author: Van Morrison

text: There is this power that comes with being famous.
author: Rod Stewart

text: Martyrdom: The only way a man can become famous without ability.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Save your rejections so that later when you are famous you can show them to people and laugh.
author: Meg Cabot

text: I believe some people in this business suffer from fame because they behave in a famous fashion.
author: Stephen Rea

text: I don't like Los Angeles. The people are awful and terribly shallow, and everybody wants to be famous but nobody wants to play the game. I'm from New York. I will kill to get what I need.
author: Lady Gaga

text: Among famous traitors of history one might mention the weather.
author: Ilka Chase

text: Wood burns because it has the proper stuff in it and a man becomes famous because he has the proper stuff in him.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: I'm just not a private person. It's not like I do things because I want things to be public it's just that's my way of expressing myself, and I happen to be very famous.
author: Lily Allen

text: The excitement for me lies not so much in interviewing the hard-to-get famous person, but the person whom you are about to discover. You know, like maybe the character actors who are just coming into their own and you're realizing how great they are.
author: Terry Gross

text: There is less pressure as a character actor. It generally means that you will be acting for all of your life, which is my intention. It is not my intention to just be a rich and famous person, that would be pretty boring.
author: Tim Roth

text: I don't really consider myself to be famous.
author: Victoria Justice

text: I seek no longer to be a 'famous' person, and instead I wish to live a 'normal' life.
author: Sinead O'Connor

text: Exposure makes you famous, not just good work. Famous is being plastered everywhere.
author: Francesca Annis

text: Look at Gleason in The Honeymooners. He was humorous but the way he lived wasn't really humorous. He was a bus driver. Who wants to be a bus driver? He didn't have any money and he was not famous. But despite that, the show is humorous.
author: George Thorogood

text: I'm world famous, everywhere I go there are people who love me because of I've been able to bring them some joy from the movies I've made.
author: Tony Curtis

text: What I've learned is that you really don't need to be a celebrity or have money or have the paparazzi following you around to be famous.
author: Lady Gaga

text: People seldom become famous for what they say until after they are famous for what they've done.
author: Cullen Hightower

text: Sometimes people offer you plays, they offer you parts, but they only offer it because I'm famous.
author: Chris Rock

text: The Band was always famous for its retirements we'd go and play and get a little petty cash together, and then not see each other till it was time to fill our pockets up again.
author: Rick Danko

text: When I came to New York, I began to meet the people who became the most famous artists of our time. I was insecure about my own level of ability, I didn't know whether I could compete with these people and, at the same time. I was wondering what is this anyway?
author: Henry Flynt

text: No matter how famous and established they were or however blessed they were with great songs or long careers, if they lived alone, they lived alone. That's not the way I wanted to live prior to the tour or after.
author: Edie Brickell

text: I don't want to be more famous than what I have right now. At least in that sense where people come up to me in the grocery store.
author: Kathleen Robertson

text: Italian girls are famous for being snobby and expecting men to make the first move. In America, if I don't make eye contact, the guys won't come over and talk. American girls just go for it. You men are spoiled.
author: Silvia Colloca

text: Martyrdom is the only way a man can become famous without ability.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: I think that when you are famous every weakness is exaggerated.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: It's been real weird. It wasn't how I expected my life to turn out. Especially, mainly pertaining to the show. It never crossed my mind that one day I'm gonna be big and famous and have my own TV show, you know?
author: Jack Osbourne

text: I think that people who are famous tend to be underdeveloped in their humanity skills.
author: Diane Keaton

text: I know somebody from university who's called Phil Collins and I think there's something terribly unfortunate about sharing a name With somebody who either is famous or becomes famous.
author: David Walliams

text: He makes me laugh, Mick! He tended to turn up when we were having lunch and entertain us all. He bought an Enigma machine! I've never worked with a producer who was more famous than everyone put together.
author: Saffron Burrows

text: It's interesting because people assume that because I'm famous I know all famous people.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

text: I think in the end, when you're famous, people like to narrow you down to a few personality traits. I think I've just become this ambitious, say-whatever's-on-her-mind, intimidating person. And that's part of my personality, but it's certainly not anywhere near the whole thing.
author: Madonna Ciccone

text: It's never been my purpose to become an American icon, or more famous or richer.
author: Juliette Binoche

text: Fact is, famous people say fame stinks because they love it so - like a secret restaurant or holiday island they don't want the hoi polloi to get their grubby paws on.
author: Julie Burchill

text: Usually when I see someone famous, for some reason, I think I know them.
author: Leona Lewis

text: I don't have any expectations as an actor and being rich and famous is not my driving force.
author: James D'arcy

text: I'm not comfortable being around too many people. I don't like being out in public too much. I don't like going to bars. I don't like doing celebrity stuff. So most of the characters I play are people who don't always feel comfortable beyond their small circle of friends.
author: Adam Sandler

text: There's no difference between fame and infamy now. There's a new school of professional famous people that don't do anything. They don't create anything.
author: Ricky Gervais

text: I know really, really famous people who are terrified every time they walk on to a stage.
author: Bill Nighy

text: You can get awful famous in this country in seven days.
author: Gary Hart

text: The F-word is 'famous,' the C-word is 'celebrity' and S-word is 'star,' in my book. The other three words are fine - you can say those. But 'famous,' 'celebrity' and 'star,' I think, are misused.
author: Shailene Woodley

text: I was getting a lot of editorial, as in lots of pages in 'Vogue,' but it's far more important to get your dresses on the back of a famous person. Charlotte Rampling in Bruce Oldfield. That sells.
author: Bruce Oldfield

text: Kids will keep it real. If I've ever had in my life a great anchor, it's them. They get in your head, 'don't get too famous.' If you think you're really famous and think you're really hip, go hang out with your kids for an afternoon. That's about as earthbound as it's going to get.
author: Lionel Richie

text: You're asking the wrong girl about fame. I'm hardly famous. I wouldn't want to trade places with anyone else.
author: Nikki Cox

text: A lot of people are like, 'So you want to be famous.' And I'm like, 'No, I want to be good at my craft. I don't care about fame, I don't care if I even ever make it. As long as people know what I am as an actress in this business, I'm set for my career right now.'
author: Chloe Moretz

text: I literally was famous before I knew my own name.
author: Corey Feldman

text: I get recognized, but I'm not really a famous famous.
author: Dave Attell

text: Sometimes being famous gets in the way of doing what you want to do.
author: Johnny Mathis

text: I'd had people say, 'You'll enjoy being famous for a week, and you'll never enjoy it again'. But I don't think I had that week. I may have been working and missed that moment.
author: Matt Damon

text: Now, we believe that the majority of teachers in America know our system must be reformed, to put students first so that America can compete, that teachers don't teach to become rich or famous. They teach because they love children.
author: Chris Christie

text: I'm not a very good impersonator, my friends maybe, but not famous people.
author: Diane Kruger

text: I'm not one of those famous people flying round the world emoting over every catastrophe. I'm too feeble.
author: Kristin Scott Thomas

text: Tom Cruise, he's a lot more famous than me.
author: David Beckham

text: I'm hardly famous. I wouldn't want to trade places with anyone else.
author: Nikki Cox

text: A lot of stand-up comedy guys, when they get a little famous, just give up their stand-up career, and it cancels out the thing that set them apart.
author: Johnny Knoxville

text: The big thing that everyone forgets, you're famous and on TV and everything, but I think there's something very rewarding to be able to write a song, record it, and have it turn out as you heard it in your head, or even better.
author: Phil Collen

text: Acting is not about being famous, it's about exploring the human soul.
author: Annette Bening

text: The first pork-barrel bill that crosses my desk, I'm going to veto it and make the authors of those pork-barrel items famous all over America.
author: John McCain

text: We need to teach our kids, because there is such a celebrity culture at the moment, that however rich you are, however famous you are, however glamorous you are, everyone has to live by the same rules.
author: Nick Clegg

text: Right now I'm the most famous silent movie actress in the world and I want to keep that for me. So I hope there's not going to be any other silent movies.
author: Berenice Bejo

text: Being a famous actress may give you a sense of being important, but believe me, it's just an illusion.
author: Juliette Binoche

text: Yeah, I like to be the maker of the art. And I like and want the money. But I don't really dig being famous.
author: Liz Phair

text: You want a hero in the music world? James Brown. He brought a feeling to music without really using words. He's just famous for his sound.
author: David Lee Roth

text: The problem is, the more famous you get, the more people see you who didn't choose to.
author: Louis C. K.

text: The real harm of term extension comes not from these famous works. The real harm is to the works that are not famous, not commercially exploited, and no longer available as a result.
author: Lawrence Lessig

text: I'm famous for splurging at fast-food places. I'm currently obsessed with Taco Bell's bean and cheese burritos with extra green sauce and extra cheese. Gluttony!
author: Fergie

text: I was obsessed with being rich and famous.
author: Paul Lynde

text: I think there are a lot of people who really want to be famous, they really do. I don't. It sort of gets in the way of the everyday things that I do.
author: Johnny Mathis

text: You don't become a chef to become famous.
author: Eric Ripert

text: I have never wanted to be famous, as such - fame is a by-product.
author: Steve Coogan

text: I got very famous for a minute and then it just all went away, you know? And for the last 20 years - you've got to pick yourself up and dust yourself off and then go on your merry way and start again, in a sense, and that's what I've been doing.
author: Colin Hay

text: I'm famous. That's my job.
author: Jerry Rubin

text: You don't have to be rich and famous. You just have to be an ordinary person, doing extraordinary things. I'd like more people to know that it's there. Women's achievements still aren't recognised enough in many areas.
author: Joan Armatrading

text: It's funny - nowadays people that are famous get chased by paparazzi. They have this fame, but they don't have the money to hide from it.
author: Matt LeBlanc

text: Quite often I can be in a bookshop, standing beneath a great big picture of myself and paying for a book with a credit card clearly marked John Grisham, yet no one recognises me. I often say I'm a famous author in a country where no one reads.
author: John Grisham

text: Famous people feel that they must perpetually be on the crest of the wave, not realising that it is against all the rules of life. You can't be on top all the time, it isn't natural.
author: Olivia De Havilland

text: When we were growing up our parents somehow made it clear that being famous was good. And I mistakenly thought that if I was famous then everyone would love me.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: For me, I never, never, from the moment I started acting, had a desire to be famous.
author: Carla Gugino

text: In the sixties, everyone you knew became famous. My flatmate was Terence Stamp. My barber was Vidal Sassoon. David Hockney did the menu in a restaurant I went to. I didn't know anyone unknown who didn't become famous.
author: Michael Caine

text: Oh yeah, I was one of the first guys writing comic books, I wrote Captain America, with guys like Stan Lee, who became famous later on with Marvel Comics.
author: Mickey Spillane

text: I got out of autobiography because my story is, I was famous, it was hard for me, I got into therapy. I had trouble with food, I got a nutritionist. There's no story there.
author: Courtney Thorne Smith

text: Being famous is having the power to really implement positive change in the world, and it gives you the power to do what you want. I'm really grateful for it because I can play music and people will listen.
author: Sean Lennon

text: I don't go to premieres. I don't go to parties. I don't covet the Oscar. I don't want any of that. I don't go out. I just have dinner at home every night with my kids. Being famous, that's a whole other career. And I haven't got any energy for it.
author: Gary Oldman

text: Don't worry about writing a book or getting famous or making money. Just lead an interesting life.
author: Michael Morpurgo

text: I don't have the life of a famous person. But I do feel like I've been able to connect with a lot of people.
author: Ann Brashares

text: I will either be famous or infamous.
author: Otto Dix

text: I never wanted to be a celebrity I never wanted to be famous. And in my daily life, I work really hard to not trade on it in any way.
author: Sarah Jessica Parker

text: I can do whatever I want - I'm rich, I'm famous, and I'm bigger than you.
author: Don Johnson

text: Hollywood people want to build you up and make you famous only to knock you off you're the pedestal they built for you.
author: Morgan Brittany

text: I am the most well-adjusted human being I know. I started out this investigation as a very happy man with a great career. I've got the life people dream about: I am rich, I am famous, I've got a fabulous marriage to an absolutely, spell-bindingly brilliant woman.
author: James Ellroy

text: I remember Michael saying, 'Rich and famous? It's much better to be just rich'. I didn't quite get it to begin with. But he's right. You lose anonymity. I say to my family that you've no idea until you lose it how precious anonymity is.
author: Julie Walters

text: When I started on MySpace, people wanted to support me, but once I rose to fame with the MTV show, they felt like I had abandoned them for some reason, that I was too famous to talk to them anymore.
author: Tila Tequila

text: I worked on scores. I went to the musical library in Berlin which is very famous. I discovered that we had scores of Beethoven, printed scores of Beethoven, that are full of mistakes. Not the wrong or false notes, but the wrong dynamic, understandable things.
author: Kurt Masur

text: I just want to make music, I don't want people to talk about me. All I've ever wanted to do was sing. I don't want to be a celebrity. I don't want to be in people's faces, you know, constantly on covers of magazine that I haven't even known I'm on.
author: Adele

text: I've been accustomed to being famous and having a certain level of attention for 14 years, but in the last few months, it's changed. It's like on the arcade game, I've gone up to the next level.
author: Kylie Minogue

text: While we are being fascinated by the tales of famous serial killers and how they were brought to justice, the real serial killer goes about his business with hardly a thought to being caught.
author: Pat Brown

text: When I was a kid, the idea of why I wanted acting to be the thing I do for the rest of my life was different. It was, Oh yeah, I'll get girls and be famous.
author: Edward Furlong

text: There are a lot of famous comedians from Liverpool, then obviously the Beatles, and the football club. That's what people in Liverpool are passionate about.
author: Ian Rush

text: The only reason I became the singer in the band is because I sang the best. It wasn't out of some desire to be a star or be a famous singer. It's not like I love interviews.
author: Adam Levine

text: Berry Gordy turned his house into a studio and discovered over 30 acts in the city. And we're famous all over the world.
author: Martha Reeves

text: I'm famous by default. I came out of the womb, and people wanted to know who I was because of my parents.
author: Frances Bean Cobain

text: It's every teenager's dream to be in a band, tour the world and be famous.
author: Joey McIntyre

text: Nobody wants to end up super rich and famous - but divorced. I'm always clear on that and try to stay on the right side of the line.
author: Bear Grylls

text: I have no interest in Shakespeare and all that British nonsense... I just wanted to get famous and all the rest is hogwash.
author: Anthony Hopkins

text: I like photographing the people I love, the people I admire, the famous, and especially the infamous. My last infamous subject was the extreme right wing French politician Jean-Marie Le Pen.

text: I am famous because I am an African American jazz artist.
author: Nat King Cole

text: But I don't feel the need to be famous.
author: Jessica Alba

text: Face it, I didn't become famous until I took my clothes off.

text: I have been very happy, very rich, very beautiful, much adulated, very famous and very unhappy.

text: I'm doing a new musical on Broadway, which opens in October called 'The Boy from Oz,' where I play Peter Allen. For those of you who don't know, he became first famous in America for marrying Liza Minelli.

text: I became famous almost before I had a craft.
author: Farrah Fawcett

text: I'm willing to make compromises based on someone I think is the one, but I think it's psychologically important to people when they're famous to be the only famous person they know.
author: John Mayer

text: If I wanted to be famous, I could have been famous before.
author: David Gest

text: I love being famous. It's almost like being white.
author: Chris Rock

text: I have no use for people who throw their weight around as celebrities, or for those who fawn over you just because you are famous.

text: I try to become more humble and more myself with every year. There was a while when I got famous where I was so confused and my head was spinning.

text: Celebrity culture, it's everywhere, isn't it? It's reality TV, Big Brother. I didn't become a footballer to be famous, I became a footballer to be successful. I didn't want to be famous. Now people want to be famous. Why? Why would you want people following you about all day?

text: I don't do the whole, 'Put my name on it, make me famous' thing.
author: T-Pain

text: Well, I think a lot of people just want to be famous.
author: Dan Fogler

text: Ever since grammar school, I knew I wanted to be famous - I always wanted to be a singer.
author: Jennifer Hudson

text: I don't like the idea of famous people.
author: Kristin Hersh

text: When I was growing up, I thought I'd be a lot happier if I was famous and successful and if I had money.
author: Russell Brand

text: I always thought it was strange when these artists like Kurt Cobain or whoever would get really famous and say, 'I don't understand why this is happening to me.' There is a mathematical formula to why you got famous. It isn't some magical thing that just started happening.

text: When someone becomes successful or rich and famous, people perceive that person as being different. But I'm the same guy I've always been.

text: We are not interested in cloning the Michael Jordans and the Michael Jacksons of this world. The rich and the famous don't participate in this.

text: Major success feels a bit like a coronation. Like I'd become a king. I was one of the most famous people in the world, loved and hated in equal measure. I couldn't see anything bad with it. It made me a happy person.
author: Larry Hagman

text: I want to thank all the women who have worn my clothes, the famous and the unknown, who have been so faithful to me and given me so much joy.
author: Yves Saint Laurent

text: My favorite thing about being famous... it's not really as big of a deal as everybody says it is. Being on the road is tough, doing interviews, and all the stuff. It's still pretty tough.
author: Aaron Carter

text: When I'm living in the world of luxury and celebrity, which is where I found myself for a large part of my life, it's a walk-on part. Not a vital necessity, like it is for so many people. I enjoy it but I can see right through it!

text: I never wanted to be the most famous, the most beautiful, the most extravagant.
author: Manolo Blahnik

text: Other famous men, those of much talk and few deeds, soon evaporate. Action is the dignity of greatness.
author: Jose Marti

text: They used to but not any more. You kind of get used to it - you accept it is part of your job - if you're famous and you want this life, you have got to accept this part of it as well.

text: We played in Texas about a year ago, at Emo's, the famous country and western club in Austin. And I figured, well, if I'm finally gonna die onstage, that's where it's going to be!
author: Alan Vega

text: I heard so many stories from Gaomi's peasants that I had an irrepressible urge to write them down. Today, Gaomi's peasants know that they have become famous around the world through my writings, but I think they are a little puzzled by this.
author: Mo Yan

text: I actually don't feel famous.
author: Anwar Robinson

text: The famous saying 'God is love', it is generally assumed, means that God is like our immediate emotional indulgence, not that the meaning of love ought to have something of the 'otherness' and terror of God.

text: I don't ever want to be hugely famous because I had a little taste of it after 'East Is East' and 'Bend It.'

text: Some people with blogs are never going to get famous, and they've been doing it for, like, over a year. I feel bad for them.

text: I think success right now is not about how famous you are or how much you're getting paid, but it's more about if you're steadily working and you're happy with what you're doing.
author: Sarah Hyland

text: The whole 'American Idol' way of looking at things is the antithesis of what I grew up with. There are a whole lot of kids wanting to be famous now, whereas if I'd even mentioned that word to one of my teachers, I would have got into a whole load of trouble.

text: I felt so painfully isolated that I vowed I would get revenge on the world by becoming a famous cartoonist.
author: Robert Crumb

text: I don't think I'll ever feel as famous or as popular as I felt when I was a 17-year-old soccer player in Modle. Only about 20,000 people live there and 12,000 of them come to every game. Running onto the pitch each week was just the most fantastic feeling. Nothing can beat that.

text: There aren't many downsides to being rich, other than paying taxes and having relatives asking for money. But being famous, that's a 24 hour job right there.

text: George Harrison was also a pleasure to work with. He was one of the most famous people I've ever known, but in spite of that fame, he was such a nice and friendly guy.
author: Alvin Lee

text: I've never dreamed of being famous. The idea of it really scares me.
author: Jeremy London

text: When I was young, I did actually model and was much photographed by famous photographers. But I was always a bookworm.

text: I'm famous today. People like me today. Might not like me tomorrow. You can't count on it.

text: Fate is being kind to me. Fate doesn't want me to be too famous too young.

text: I don't really know a lot of famous people. I've met a lot of famous people. If I ran into Tom Hanks today, I would have to remind him who I was and he would then remember me. But he wouldn't come up to me and say, 'Hi Dave!'

text: None of my characters are rich or famous, and the situations they find themselves in could happen to anyone.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: There has been a time on earth when poets had been young and dead and famous - and were men. But now the poet as the tragic child of grandeur and destiny had changed. The child of genius was a woman, now, and the man was gone.

text: There's so many things I want to do. I want to work with great filmmakers, great actors, great scripts. And there's no reason for me to do anything short of that, because I'm 24, I don't have a family, I don't need to make tons of money, and I'm not dying to get famous.

text: I don't really see myself as famous.
author: MyAnna Buring

text: Just because you're not famous, doesn't mean you're not good.
author: Laura Linney

text: I get to meet fantastic people, and I get to go through so many emotions. For me, I have a craving for that. When I'm acting, I feel great. It's not to be famous.

text: I made a conscious decision back then that I would rather be the best actress who ever lived than the most famous one.
author: Sally Kirkland

text: Indy makes the race driver. You become famous when you come here.
author: Rodger Ward

text: Exploitation films were famous for taking an issue an exploiting it because they could move much faster than a studio could. If there was any hot topic, they would run out and make a quick movie and make a buck on it, by changing it around and using it, in some way, to give some relevance.
author: Robert Rodriguez

text: The stones themselves are thick with history, and those cats that dash through the alleyways must surely be the ghosts of the famous dead in feline disguise.
author: Erica Jong

text: Maya Angelou, the famous African American poet, historian, and civil rights activist who is hailed be many as one of the great voices of contemporary literature, believes a struggle only makes a person stronger.
author: Michael N. Castle

text: You can get rich or famous by doing the same thing.
author: Ang Lee

text: I feel very strong as an individual, but as a famous footballer I know I am prone to certain things. All the media have a continuous interest for me. It varies from once a year to every day interest.

text: My idea of a good picture is one that's in focus and of a famous person.
author: Andy Warhol

text: I think it's real easy to be famous these days it's not real easy to sustain success.

text: I'd die if I was Madonna. I'd die. God, what a horrible way to live. And Michael Jackson! To be so famous and to feel so isolated. I feel so bad for them. I don't know how it feels, and I hope it never happens to me.

text: The records of adopted children are sealed in California. That seal is considered inviolable... The judge ruled that, because I was famous, he didn't have the same rights as other kids.
author: Danielle Steel

text: At last, in 1611, was made, under the auspices of King James, the famous King James version and this is the great literary monument of the English language.
author: Lafcadio Hearn

text: Going to New York to do whatever - show business - it just seemed fun. It seemed fun to go to the big city and meet all kinds of different people and maybe be famous. It was just exciting. So I wasn't scared.

text: There are a lot of good things about being famous but there are a few not so good things too.

text: The first time I went to Johnny Depp's house in LA is when I realized what I was getting myself into. I knew he was famous, but I didn't really know what that entailed.
author: Kate Moss

text: Public misbehavior by the famous is a powerful teaching tool.
author: Bill O'Reilly

text: Hitler was so modern, in that he was obsessed with being famous. He was caught up with this rush to be have achieved greatness before turning 30.
author: John Cusack

text: So I'm a young boy in the 1940s growing up, seeing Ralph Bunche on a regular basis, seeing Duke Ellington on a regular basis. We know that these people are famous. They're living in the same community as we live in. They go to the same stores and shops.
author: Ed Smith

text: For me, getting comfortable with being famous was hard - that whole side of it, the loss of anonymity, the loss of privacy. Giving up that part of your life and not having control of it.

text: In the future everyone will be famous for 15 minutes.
author: Andy Warhol

text: You can become famous but you can't become unfamous. You can become infamous but not unfamous.

text: In Los Angeles, as I gained and lost celebrity, then gained it again, I often found myself wondering why I, out of thousands like me, had become famous.

text: After a fellow gets famous it doesn't take long for someone to bob up that used to sit by him in school.

text: Few if any teenagers can relate to getting up for school and finding famous comics like Pryor and Williams hanging out in your living room after a hard night of partying. But that's Hollywood.

text: You get to be famous or have some notoriety and there are so many people who want a piece of you.

text: I also want to go to an Italian island and do cuisine properly with some famous Italian chef and, like, his mother.
author: Elizabeth Olsen

text: By virtue of some of the ways the game is played, in terms of message discipline, in terms of access for reporters, and especially in the way that sources and subjects, especially famous subjects, treat the media, almost by default there's more news that's falling into books.
author: Ron Suskind

text: What a heavy burden is a name that has become too famous.
author: Voltaire

text: I've always been more drawn to being normal than being famous.
author: Vince Gill

text: I'm famous for being nicer to my fans than anyone on the face of the Earth because I figure a) They pay my salary, and b) It's probably like a big moment in your life to meet somebody so I would say, just come on up.

text: The fire in the belly is essential, otherwise you become Michael Buble - famous and meaningless.

text: I don't think I'll ever be comfortable with the idea of being famous.

text: Any idiot can get laid when they're famous. That's easy. It's getting laid when you're not famous that takes some talent.

text: You know, I did not like being famous. It was a stressful and ugly time, and I'm glad it's over.

text: It was pretty frightening because as we all know, when large, famous groups breakup, a lot of the members don't survive in solo careers.

text: I just don't feel much interested in the lifestyles of the rich and famous.

text: I don't want to be famous. I want to be secure. I don't want the world. I just want a piece of it. I want people to remember Eric Davis.
author: Eric Davis

text: My discrepancy with children in the industry is that they are made famous before they know who they are as human beings.

text: I think being famous is more of a hindrance, a constraint, than just letting yourself be free.

text: You'll know if you're a famous composer if 20 years from now your name appears on a pull-down menu in Band in a Box, alongside Hans Zimmer.

text: I've never sat there and plotted out how I was going to become successful or famous.

text: People are famous for being famous and for nothing else. And good luck to them, because it lasts about a year and then they're nothing again.

text: The most famous person in my phone is Lindsay Lohan. We starred in 'Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen' together in 2004 and we've stayed in touch.

text: There are high spots in all of our lives and most of them have come about through encouragement from someone else. I don't care how great, how famous or successful a man or woman may be, each hungers for applause.

text: The worst thing about being famous is the invasion of your privacy.

text: I studied Japanese language and culture in college and graduate school, and afterward went to work in Tokyo, where I met a young man whose father was a famous businessman and whose mother was a geisha.

text: I'm learning as I go. I don't know everything. I never had anybody to look at, nobody ever taught me, and where I'm from I didn't have any famous role models.
author: Wale

text: I fear that, in the end, the famous debate among materialists, idealists, and dualists amounts to a merely verbal dispute that is more a matter for the linguist than for the speculative philosopher.

text: I'm the man that made wrestling famous.
author: Hulk Hogan

text: You know, I'm a television personality. It's not like I'm a famous hooker or something!
author: Brett Somers

text: I used to think no one should go into show biz, but now I feel differently. I now feel like it's a great career. If you can do it and make money at it and still not be so famous that you can have a normal life - then I think it's a great career.

text: When you reach a certain status in Hollywood, you have to play a lot of games to stay in the limelight. It becomes more about being famous than being an actor.

text: Sometimes I like to play the soundtracks to famous musicals so we can all sing along. South Pacific is one of my favorites. Our neighbors must hate us.

text: But just playing the partner of someone famous, I had a lot more freedom.
author: Rachel Griffiths

text: You can be famous for a lot of things. You can be a Nobel-prize winner. You can be the fattest guy in the world.
author: Evel Knievel

text: I think the thing to remember, though, the next time you hear someone who is really certain that he is on the side of the angels, is that the idea of angels was created by human beings, who are famous for being frequently untrustworthy and occasional.

text: We all want to be famous people, and the moment we want to be something we are no longer free.

text: One of the hardest things for me, now that I'm famous, is finding people who can read my stuff and give me an honest critique.
author: Ken Follet

text: I may not be the most famous songwriter in the world, but you know a David Friedman song when you hear it. It took me a long time to appreciate that.

text: I can't see any value in being a celebrity, famous for being famous.
author: Noomi Rapace

text: I wanted to be successful, not famous.
