text: In opera, as with any performing art, to be in great demand and to command high fees you must be good of course, but you must also be famous. The two are different things.

text: I certainly don't think you need to be famous to want to leave a legacy, but when you are famous, it's even more likely that your child will get the wrong perspective on your life if you die prematurely.

text: I'd rather be able to face myself in the bathroom mirror than be rich and famous.

text: And I don't want to live anywhere where I am famous. It makes me very, very uncomfortable, because it conveys an advantage over people, and I don't like that.
author: Donna Leon

text: In Germany I am not so famous.

text: Since I was seventeen I thought I might be a star. I'd think about all my heroes, Charlie Parker, Jimi Hendrix... I had a romantic feeling about how these people became famous.

text: Who elected Larry King America's grief counselor? We, the viewing public, did, by driving up his ratings whenever somebody famous passes.

text: Before I was famous, when I was just working in Gilbert's Lodge, everything was moving in slow motion.

text: I remember, when I was an up-and-coming comic, how annoyed I would be when the famous guys would show up and just take everyone's spots.

text: My buildings are more famous than me.
author: Jean Nouvel

text: I had a very erratic career. I got very famous for a minute and then it just all went away, you know?
author: Colin Hay

text: I wanted to be a rich, famous rock-and-roll star in that order.
author: Dee Snider

text: I kept saying that I'd never live in L.A., and I didn't think I would. But that's where the work is, and I ended up making a lot of friends there, and my old friends moved out to Los Angeles too. And also, I think when you're famous, its hard to live in a small town.
author: John Cusack

text: I love meeting famous people. I'm even happy just looking at them.
author: Joey McIntyre

text: I felt no pressure that my grandfather was famous and my uncle was famous.
author: Kim Weston

text: I like being famous when it's convenient for me and completely anonymous when it's not.
author: Catherine Deneuve

text: There's more pressure to be famous for being yourself than if you're being a character.
author: Kim Kardashian

text: Because I think in order to get famous you have to be known for something. Like 'You're the romantic comedy girl' or 'You're the Oscar-winning whatever girl.'
author: Rachel Weisz

text: I met a lot of famous people when I was about 24. And none of them seemed very appealing. And so I didn't know why I would struggle to be that kind of person.

text: I never wanted to be famous.
author: Dave Attell

text: I don't have famous neighbours and if I did, I'd avoid them. I don't live the jet-set.
author: Vanessa Paradis

text: At the time when this famous historical battle was fought in Kosovo, the people were looking at the stars, expecting aid from them. Now, six centuries later, they are looking at the stars again, waiting to conquer them.
author: Slobodan Milosevic

text: I certainly don't want a child of mine to be famous, or anyone I was very close to who isn't yet... It's the worst thing to be trapped in your house not be able to leave.
author: Elizabeth Hurley

text: I hope this doesn't sound pompous but I don't think of myself as famous, whatever fame I've got has come through what I've done and associations of things I've done.
author: Peter Cushing

text: It is a mark of many famous people that they cannot part with their brightest hour.
author: Lillian Hellman

text: People hate me because I am a multifaceted, talented, wealthy, internationally famous genius.
author: Jerry Lewis

text: Sonny and another Hells Angel who was at the meeting thought they were beyond a little patch so they headed down to a local tattoo shop in Oakland and were the first to get the famous One Percent tattoos.
author: Chuck Zito

text: In approaching our subject it will be best, without attempting to shorten the path by referring to famous theories of the drama, to start directly from the facts, and to collect from them gradually an idea of Shakespearean Tragedy.
author: Andrew Coyle Bradley

text: I think that as soon as you think of yourself as a famous person or anything like that, you're objectifying yourself in some weird way.
author: Ethan Hawke

text: People just assume that if you're famous, you're in Hollywood.
author: Megan Fox

text: I really had little interest in becoming famous. When I write my book, it will be my guide to avoid becoming a rock star.
author: Edgar Winter

text: I got the famous Oprah hug!
author: Taylor Lautner

text: I served the famous professors and scholars, and eventually they learned that the Reverend Moon is superior to them. Even Nobel laureate academics who thought they were at the center of knowledge are as nothing in front of me.
author: Sun Myung Moon

text: I've been very, very lucky in my career, in my life - from day one. When aspiring directors say, 'What's your advice?' first I say, 'Be born the son of a famous director. It's invaluable.'
author: Jason Reitman

text: I was very famous as a young man and I celebrated both the good and bad times with drinking.
author: Glenn Hughes

text: As a famous person you think how you're gonna end it, get away and have a normal life.
author: Gwen Stefani

text: A very quiet and tasteful way to be famous is to have a famous relative. Then you can not only be nothing, you can do nothing too.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

text: It is more interesting to be compared to someone famous, because it lets you gauge what perceptions people have about your appearance.
author: Arthur Smith

text: I had a flight trainer who is one of the biggest and most famous helicopter pilots the world.
author: Izabella Scorupco

text: I didn't get into skating to be famous.
author: Eric Heiden

text: I'm actually about as famous as a fourth division footballer from the 70s.
author: Dylan Moran

text: I guess we decided to make a new record 3 years ago when Nancy was done scoring for Almost Famous.
author: Ann Wilson

text: Pulp existed for 12 years before we got famous. Now, you could say that was just lack of imagination, but it's some kind of quality isn't it? Tenacity. You could also say it was sloth.
author: Jarvis Cocker

text: I don't need to be wildly famous for my life to make sense.
author: Cory Monteith

text: If somebody tells me I'm famous I say, 'I'm not.' I can't see myself as famous and I don't think I'll ever call myself famous. I definitely don't feel famous.

text: I really feel like it's a travesty to make a child famous. I really do.
author: Joe Rogan

text: Be very clear as to what your dream is. Nowadays it is fairly certain that 90 percent of all actors really just want to be rich and famous as the solution to all that ails.
author: Dirk Benedict

text: I totally related to Cole Porter's magnetic pull to any piano that was in the room, which he was famous for doing, as was Gershwin. You couldn't drag them away from a piano.
author: Kevin Kline

text: A lot of the greatest compositions were made famous by Sinatra.
author: Michael Bolton

text: I was famous overnight. I went from nowhere to being really big.
author: Sting

text: It isn't false modesty when I say this, but although I am supposed to be a famous person it doesn't mean anything to me. I just sit at home and work.
author: Gyorgy Legeti

text: I was in a karaoke video in 1991, for a song called 'Sukiyaki,' which is a very famous Japanese song, and I've actually heard from people that they've been in bars in Asia where they've seen me come up in the 'Sukiyaki' video that they play behind you. I'm in that. I'm in a karaoke video.
author: Michael Weatherly

text: You're not famous until my mother has heard of you.
author: Jay Leno

text: We were delighted to have Nigel as a producer. The only problem is that Nigel is so famous that he seems to dominate most interviews without being there.
author: Stephen Malkmus

text: It's not my goal to be a famous actor.
author: Gavin DeGraw

text: Famous people come up to me, but I don't know who they are because my sight is so bad. It's always at the pool of the Four Seasons in Beverly Hills when I don't have my lenses in and my glasses are in my room.
author: Helena Bonham Carter

text: They can gas me, but I am famous. I have achieved in one day what it took Robert Kennedy all his life to do.
author: Sirhan Sirhan

text: Its only when you are a great actor and are recognised for your good work that you become famous. Unless you are in the news for the wrong reasons!
author: Christine Lahti

text: I'm coming out with a wine... I'm actually a restaurateur. I have Famous Famiglia Pizzeria that has opened up in the Sacramento airport. I'm also working with my business partner on opening up the Linnethia Lounge.
author: NeNe Leakes

text: For famous men have the whole earth as their memorial.
author: Pericles

text: I actually don't know anyone who wants to be famous for fame's sake, at least not anyone I respect. But you need to have a certain amount of power in order to be able to do what you want.
author: Michael Ian Black

text: Famous crime stories almost always lead to the passing of new laws.
author: Bill James

text: I don't mean being famous is a perk, because one knows that it's not necessarily a perk, but there are certain perks to being well-known and respected in one's field. Public perks. Like, I don't know, general friendliness and willingness to please, just to point out two.
author: Emma Thompson

text: Some of the things I've seen a lot of my female-actress friends who are relatively famous receive - I've seen some hideous things. Like some really, really bad things... like, the FBI should be contacted immediately.
author: Elisha Cuthbert

text: I had a very famous trainer tell me once, 'You can usually train a wild animal but never tame a wild animal, ever.' They are always going to be wild, no matter what anybody says.
author: Jack Hanna

text: I have a profound empathy for people who are in the public eye, whether they manifest it themselves or whether it happened by accident - it doesn't matter to me. I think there's a great misunderstanding of what it is to be famous.
author: Alanis Morissette

text: I could have been more famous if I did all the glitzy things, but celebrity always seemed so unnecessary.
author: Enya

text: It's really easy to avoid the tabloids. You just live your life and don't hang out with famous people who are in the tabloids. Don't do anything controversial and be a normal person. Have friends. And get a job and keep working.
author: Amanda Seyfried

text: I thought the more famous I became, the more friendships I would have, but the opposite was true.
author: Alanis Morissette

text: I was never famous as a kid. That's the biggest difference between me and any other kid actor is that I wasn't famous as a kid.
author: Seth Green

text: When I wasn't famous, I had a lot of friends, almost all of them Italian. The racism only started when I started to play football.
author: Mario Balotelli

text: To enjoy being famous, you need to have a screw loose.
author: Diablo Cody

text: I put my money in the bank: I have to think of life after modeling, when I'm not famous any more.
author: Eva Herzigova

text: What makes the Stones' arrogance so divine is that we all believe that long ago and far away they weren't rich and famous but poor and struggling, just like us.
author: Jon Landau

text: I would love to do a biopic of a famous singer, like Diana Ross or Donna Summer, or an old jazz story that we haven't seen before. I would love to do that! I would love to play Diana Ross 'cause she's an icon. I'm salivating to do that.
author: Taraji P. Henson

text: My office walls are covered with autographs of famous writers - it's what my children call my 'dead author wall.' I have signatures from Mark Twain, Earnest Hemingway, Jack London, Harriett Beecher Stowe, Pearl Buck, Charles Dickens, Rudyard Kipling, Alfred, Lord Tennyson, to name a few.
author: Debbie Macomber

text: Yankee Stadium, and the Yankees are so famous for Mickey Mantle, Joe DiMaggio, Lou Gehrig, all of those guys.
author: Bert Campaneris

text: The fame thing is interesting because I never wanted to be famous, and I never dreamt I would be famous.
author: J. K. Rowling

text: I know it's a cliche but I never wanted to be famous. I don't believe anybody wants to be famous.
author: Jeremy Renner

text: I know I'm not supposed to have any opinions about politics, because I'm famous.
author: Cher

text: You do now have one in three people, as shown by the famous Carlton Monarchy debate poll, saying they want to get rid of the Monarchy. That was unthinkable even three, four years ago.
author: Anthony Holden

text: I think that once you open the door and allow people in on a certain aspect, it's very hard to then control how far that ripple effect is. So I think that the person who is known or famous has the ability to decide what they do or don't want to share.
author: Rosie O'Donnell

text: I became an actor, and because I had success as an actor, I became famous. I was acting for quite a while before I got famous television made me famous. I guess that it's television that is responsible for everybody's desire to be famous.
author: Kelsey Grammer

text: It wasn't glamorous in my day. In the regions, reporters were seen as such low life that they didn't merit their name in the Radio Times. Now people are interested in being famous. I never gave it a thought.
author: Kate Adie

text: Everyone will be famous for 15 minutes.
author: Andy Warhol

text: Everyone always asks me, 'Do you want to be famous... ' I never really thought about becoming famous. I just want to work, to be able to put out inspiring and good film and TV.
author: Kim Shaw

text: If you ever get rich and famous, by definition you are special. You have done something special, and therefore you start to behave special. Then if the floor drops out, and you become down and out, you have a really new perspective.
author: Danny Bonaduce

text: The one thing you've got to say about Columbia is that it has courses that are famous. It has alumni who come back and say it was the best thing they ever did.
author: William Scott

text: The Bronx is famous for two things. Hip-hop, and 26 world championships.
author: Kurtis Blow

text: The press attack people to sell more papers without thinking, but when you get famous you have to put up with this kind of stuff.
author: Roberto Cavalli

text: The hardest thing about being famous is that people are always nice to you.
author: Robert De Niro

text: OK, so I'm not famous for the right reasons.
author: William Hung

text: For now I'm just enjoying being a mom. I don't want to be more famous and more rich. I want to be a good mom.
author: Jewel

text: The advantage of taking pictures of the famous is that they get published.
author: Elliott Erwitt

text: I don't know about this thing - being famous. I haven't figured it out yet. It still mystifies me.
author: Helen Slater

text: To seduce a woman famous for strict morals, religious fervor and the happiness of her marriage: what could possibly be more prestigious?
author: Christopher Hampton

text: I have also just finished three weeks on a soap opera in England. The soap opera is a rather famous one called Crossroads. It was first on television 25 years ago, and it has recently been brought back. I play the part of a businessman called David Wheeler.
author: Jeremy Bulloch

text: And I want to be able to - you know, make Republicans and Democrats famous for keeping jobs in California.
author: Meg Whitman

text: I've worked with a lot of people who are more famous than myself who are terribly insecure.
author: Barry Gibb

text: It's horrible how money and fame can make you acceptable while, if you're not famous or rich, you're not acceptable.
author: Bruno Tonioli

text: If somebody for some reason, for music or for movie, becomes famous, it's because they have something, something special.
author: Roberto Cavalli

text: Persons famous in the arts partake of the immortality of princes, and are upon a footing with them.
author: Francis I

text: In New York, after that famous home run, they expected me to be up there every year. That homer raised me to a high level, with the top guys in the game.
author: Bobby Thomson

text: I don't like being recognised, I have no interest in being famous at all, I just do what I do. If I could be like Captain Kirk and beam myself up and then beam myself down, I would!
author: Bruce Dickinson

text: Andy Warhol made fame more famous.
author: Fran Lebowitz

text: The people I want are very famous and very rich, and all I can offer them is a bit of exposure on TV and a bit of cash, so it's a miracle we get any guests at all. But we have been very lucky.
author: Graham Norton

text: Although I get so much fan mail from Great Britain, tell me, am I more famous there than Michael Madsen?
author: Tom Sizemore

text: As a shy kid growing up in Sheffield, I fantasized about how it would be great to be famous so I wouldn't actually have to talk to people and feel awkward. And of course, as we all know from fairy stories, when you achieve that ambition, you find out you don't want it.
author: Jarvis Cocker

text: The love of the famous, like all strong passions, is quite abstract. Its intensity can be measured mathematically, and it is independent of persons.
author: Susan Sontag

text: I think there are a lot more writers who are actors than you know they just don't have roles on famous TV shows that you recognize.
author: Danny Strong

text: I'm not unknown, yet I'm not super famous where I can't go anywhere.
author: Justin Guarini

text: Being famous as a writer is like being famous in a village. It's not really any very heady fame.
author: Peter Carey

text: I've only ever wanted to be a singer I never wanted to be famous.
author: Katherine Jenkins

text: If you look closely, there is no book more visual than Three Trapped Tigers, in that it is filled with blank pages, dark pages, it has stars made of words, the famous magical cube made of numbers, and there is even a page which is a mirror.
author: Guillermo Cabrera Infante

text: I have a great job writing for 'The Office,' but, really, all television writers do is dream of one day writing movies. I'll put it this way: At the Oscars the most famous person in the room is, like, Angelina Jolie. At the Emmys the huge exciting celebrity is Bethenny Frankel. You get what I mean.
author: Mindy Kaling

text: Thus, after finishing high school, I started with high expectations and enthusiasm to study chemistry at the famous Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Zurich.
author: Richard Ernst

text: I never thought about being famous.
author: Damon Wayans

text: I think I'll always be famous. I just hope I don't become infamous.
author: Cee Lo Green

text: HBO is really famous for hiring good people and staying out of their way until they ask for help, or need it. And that reputation is earned.
author: Richard Russo

text: Whenever you're the child of a famous person, you get judged in odd ways because of that.
author: Jeff Bridges

text: I'd definitely rather be rich than famous.
author: Radha Mitchell

text: I do not like being famous. I like being normal.
author: Vince Gill

text: Once you're famous you can't go back.
author: Matthew Morrison

text: We had such a wonderful set of circumstances in Wilmington. Yes, the four of us became famous literally overnight, but we were in a small town and we always knew when people were coming down. We always knew when to behave.
author: Katie Holmes

text: When you're famous, you don't get to meet people because they want you to like them when the present themselves to you, and you don't see the real people.
author: Cass Elliot

text: I never set out to be rich and famous. I wanted to follow my own path.
author: Matthew Modine

text: I have so much empathy for these young actors that are 19 and all of a sudden they're beautiful and famous and rich. I'm like, 'Oh my God, I'd be dead.'
author: Philip Seymour Hoffman

text: I love being famous - it's phenomenal.
author: Dave Chappelle

text: Indeed, wretched the man whose fame makes his misfortunes famous.
author: Lucius Accius

text: You know, I think Jesus was famous and also in a lot of trouble because he always chose people over sort of established procedures.
author: Gene Robinson

text: I've had to deal, a lot, with my own sense of intimidation at meeting famous people - especially actors, but really any famous people.
author: Charlie Kaufman

text: It was never about winning medals or being famous.
author: Nancy Kerrigan

text: I guess the nicest thing about being, I won't say famous but being popular is a more proper word for me to use would be that if you've got a recognizable name, a lot of times you can get people to do things for you ordinarily that you wouldn't get done.
author: Mickey Gilley

text: I'm English. Our dentistry is not world famous.
author: Christian Bale

text: I mean I was famous for nothing.
author: Rick Springfield

text: We were marching since we were babies and all we did was make Jane Fonda famous.
author: Robert Patrick

text: I'm more interested in being good than being famous.
author: Annie Leibovitz

text: Famous, adj.: Conspicuously miserable.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Yeah, people following me down the street and at the airport and all that. I can't imagine what it must be like for people who are, you know, actually famous.
author: Ellen Page

text: I love being famous. It validates that I have something to say.
author: Richard Lewis

text: Comedy has to be done en clair. You can't blunt the edge of wit or the point of satire with obscurity. Try to imagine a famous witty saying that is not immediately clear.
author: James Thurber

text: More than anything else, my mother wanted to be an actress - a famous actress - which in the 1950s was all about being young, sexy, and available. She was all that, and more. She had big blue eyes, alabaster skin, a heart-shaped face, a beautiful figure. She was just a knockout.
author: Meredith Baxter

text: I can never really enjoy being famous.
author: Utada Hikaru

text: I was famous from birth.
author: Peter Fonda

text: I think it's useful, as a famous person, to have as little separation between the perception of you and how you really are - because otherwise I'd be sitting here thinking I'm keeping secrets, and wondering when you're going to find out.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

text: There's such big pressure on people who are incredibly famous, on those who have people sitting outside their front door and taking photos every time they move.
author: Miranda Otto

text: King Crimson were the only really famous band I'd been in.
author: Jamie Muir

text: Famous remarks are very seldom quoted correctly.
author: Simeon Strunsky
